summary: This is an email chain from July 9, 2019, where a media inquiry from Inside Edition is forwarded internally. The inquiry asks whether Anthony Weiner is expected to testify against Jeffrey Epstein or had cooperated prior to Epstein's arrest. The forwarding email dismisses the question as 'the dumbest Epstein question so far.'

persons.name: Anthony Weiner
persons.context: Inside Edition asks if he is expected to testify against Jeffrey Epstein or had cooperated prior to Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case; the inquiry relates to testimony against him.

persons.name: Matt Sutherland
persons.role: Sr. Booking Producer at Inside Edition
persons.context: The sender of the media inquiry email asking about Anthony Weiner and Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Media inquiry speculates about a potential testimonial relationship against Epstein, but no direct connection is established in the document.

events.title: Inside Edition media inquiry about Weiner and Epstein
events.description: Inside Edition sends an email asking if Anthony Weiner is expected to testify against Jeffrey Epstein or had cooperated prior to Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's arrest
events.description: Referenced as the event prior to which cooperation might have occurred.

keyFacts: On July 9, 2019, Inside Edition inquired whether former Congressman Anthony Weiner was expected to testify against Jeffrey Epstein or had cooperated before Epstein's arrest.
The internal email forwarding the inquiry dismisses it as 'officially the dumbest Epstein question so far,' indicating the question was seen as irrelevant or baseless.
The document reflects media speculation and interest in potential witnesses or cooperators in the Epstein case following his arrest.
